column4: Then also there's the slight issue that it was dual boot - so the NTFS partition is actually the one with the boot flag.  Not certain if I could just switch the boot flag to the ext4 partition and have it work or not...
The boot flag only matters when you're using a microsoft style mbr.
so currently it boots grub from the NTFS partition - you reckon it would work just switching the boot flag to sda5 (my ext4 partition)?
I'm saying that the boot flag doesn't matter at all, it's completely ignored.
